title: Add configurable message size support
description: Extend PioSpiMaster to support configurable message sizes instead of hardcoded 50-bit transfers. Allow users to specify message bit width when creating the master, with appropriate FIFO handling and loop counter adjustments in the PIO program.

title: Update Assembler to use const generic RP2040_MAX_PROGRAM_SIZE
description: Update PIO assembler to use const generic syntax: pio::Assembler::<{ pio::RP2040_MAX_PROGRAM_SIZE }>::new() instead of the macro-based approach. This provides type safety and explicit program size constraints.

title: Support PIO0 and PIO1 with generic Instance parameter
description: Currently PioSpiMaster is hardcoded to use PIO0. Add generic trait parameter to support both PIO0 and PIO1 (or any Instance). Use embassy_rp::pio::Instance trait bound similar to how embassy-rp built-in PIO programs handle multiple PIO instances. This allows users to choose which PIO peripheral to use.

title: Fix PIO program SPI Mode 3 timing - data setup/hold violations
Fix main.rs lifetime and borrowing issues
description: src/main.rs has three compilation errors: E0597 (pio borrowed value doesn't live long enough) and two E0499 errors (cannot borrow pio as mutable more than once). Root cause: main.rs tries to create three separate PioSpiMaster instances (lines 40, 63, 86) all borrowing &mut pio, but the code structure doesn't support this pattern. The PioSpiMaster holds a reference to the state machine that needs to outlive the pio scope.

title: Refactor: Remove unsafe and transmute from PioSpiMaster
description: Replace unsafe transmute calls with safe generic lifetime parameters. Current code uses transmute to create artificial 'static lifetimes for StateMachine and LoadedProgram refs, but safe alternatives exist using proper lifetime tracking. See REFACTOR_PLAN.md for details.

title: Remove bit 50 read flag and simplify transfer API
description: Remove the bit 50 read flag design and simplify the transfer API. Once read phase is implemented in the PIO program (pio-spi-thq), transfer() will always perform both write and read phases unconditionally. Remove documented read flag from message format. Add new write() function that only pushes words to the state machine TX FIFO without waiting for RX response. This simplifies the API and removes unused conditional logic.

title: Add read phase to PIO program
description: Extend PIO program to include read phase: Currently the program only shifts data out to MOSI (write phase). Add read phase to shift data in from MISO line while toggling CLK, allowing full-duplex SPI transfers. Use read flag (bit 50) from message word to control whether read phase executes. This enables receiving responses from SPI slaves during the same transfer.
